'''General care:'''

- Glycaemic control: goal of HbA1c < 7%, careful control from the stage of pre-proliferative retinopathy, with the risk of worsening the visual prognosis.

- Blood pressure control and treatment of dyslipidaemia

'''Specialised ophthalmological care'''

- Retinal panphotocoagulation (fixation of the retina, regression of neovessels) as early as the severe RDNP stage

- Intraocular injections of corticoids (fewer indications) and VEGF inhibitors (severe, proliferative form and macular oedema)

question.title: What is the recommended goal for HbA1c levels in managing diabetic retinopathy?
question.description: What is the recommended goal for HbA1c levels in managing diabetic retinopathy?

option_a.title: HbA1c < 8%
option_a.description: A common goal for managing diabetes, but not specifically recommended for diabetic retinopathy

option_b.title: HbA1c < 7%
option_b.description: The recommended goal for managing diabetic retinopathy to prevent worsening visual prognosis

option_c.title: HbA1c < 6%
option_c.description: A more stringent goal for managing diabetes, but not specifically recommended for diabetic retinopathy

option_d.title: HbA1c < 5%
option_d.description: A less common goal for managing diabetes, but not specifically recommended for diabetic retinopathy
